comment._content: Eight (?) years later - Sir William Johnson (1862-1932) "Cumberland Street, Sydney" 1909 (NLA) - nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an2962539 .

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sembra incredibile ma....eravamo così!!!, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This photograph appears on page 123 of the following book: Karskens, Grace 1999, Inside The Rocks : the archaeology of a neighbourhood Hale & Iremonger, Sydney Bearing this caption: "'Cumberland Place' as Cribb's Lane was renamed, in 1901, showing Berry's bakery, later John Simpson's store, and the Share's hotel, re-christened the 'Hibernian' by an Irish publican, and finally called the 'Australian'. Notice how well-dressed these people are. (AONSW Government Printing Office Collection COD 121)" Trove identifier for the book: trove.nla.gov.au/work/28817147

comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence)

comment._content: Revisiting this photo two years later - the new Sydney Harbour YHA's clever acknowledgement of this image shows up on a more recent Google Street View - g.co/maps/wrk3w
